Class ModernDigitalChronology

java.lang.Object
java.time.chrono.AbstractChronology
net.xmercerweiss.mdc.ModernDigitalChronology
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<Chronology>, Chronology
public class ModernDigitalChronology extends AbstractChronology implements Serializable
The Chronology class implementing the Modern Digital Calendar system

Exclusively implements datekeeping, meaning attempting to work with time-based classes (such as LocalTime, LocalDateTime, or Duration) or values (such as ChronoUnit.HOURS) will typically throw an UnsupportedOperationException
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

    • MJD_EPOCH_OFFSET_IN_DAYS

      public static final int MJD_EPOCH_OFFSET_IN_DAYS
      The difference, in days, between an Epoch Day and a Modified Julian Day (MJD). The MJD is the number of days since midnight on November 17th 1858 ISO. January 1st 1970 ISO is MJD 40,587
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • getDisplayName

      public String getDisplayName(TextStyle style, Locale locale)
      Gets the textual representation of this Chronology suitable for presentation for the user. Always returns the same value regardless of arguments, as is done by the calendars implemented in java.time.chrono
      Specified by:
      getDisplayName in interface Chronology
      Parameters:
      style - The style of the text required; has no effect
      locale - The locale to use; has no effect

      Equivalent to ModernDigitalDate.of(Era, int, int, int)
      Specified by:
      date in interface Chronology
      Parameters:
      era - A ModernDigitalEra, not null
      yearOfEra - The year of the era, must be >= 0

    • epochDay

      public long epochDay(Era era, int yearOfEra, int monthOfYear, int dayOfMonth)
      Calculates the epoch day of the given date
      Parameters:
      era - A ModernDigitalEra, not null
      yearOfEra - The year of the era, must be >= 0
      monthOfYear - The month of the year, 0 for leap days
      dayOfMonth - The day of the month, within [1, 28]
      Returns:
      A signed 64-bit integer number of days before (<0) or since (>= 0) the epoch
      Throws:
      DateTimeException - If the given year, month, or day is invalid

    • epochDay

      public long epochDay(int prolepticYear, int monthOfYear, int dayOfMonth)
      Calculates the epoch day of the given date
      Parameters:
      prolepticYear - The number of years before (<0) or since (>= 0) 1970 ISO
      monthOfYear - The month of the year, 0 for leap days
      dayOfMonth - The day of the month, within [1, 28]
      Returns:
      A signed 64-bit integer number of days before (<0) or since (>= 0) the epoch
      Throws:
      DateTimeException - If the given month or day is invalid

    • ordinalDayOfYear

      public int ordinalDayOfYear(int monthOfYear, int dayOfMonth)
      Calculates the ordinal (1st, 2nd, 3rd...) day of the year from a month and day
      Parameters:
      monthOfYear - The month of the year, 0 for leap days
      dayOfMonth - The day of the month, within [1, 28]
      Returns:
      A signed 32-bit integer within [1, 366]
      Throws:
      DateTimeException - If the given month or day is invalid

    • ordinalDayOfWeek

      public int ordinalDayOfWeek(int monthOfYear, int dayOfMonth)
      Calculates the ordinal (1st, 2nd, 3rd...) value of the weekday to which a given day of a given month belongs
      Parameters:
      monthOfYear - The month of the year, 0 for leap days
      dayOfMonth - The day of the month, within [1, 28]
      Returns:
      A signed 32-bit integer within [0, 7], 0 for leap days as they belong to no weekday
      Throws:
      DateTimeException - If the given month or day is invalid

    • ordinalDayOfWeek

      public int ordinalDayOfWeek(int dayOfYear)
      Calculates the ordinal (1st, 2nd, 3rd...) value of the weekday to which a given day belongs
      Parameters:
      dayOfYear - The day of the year, within [1, 366]
      Returns:
      A signed 32-bit integer within [0, 7], 0 for leap days as they belong to no weekday
      Throws:
      DateTimeException - If the given day is invalid

    • ordinalWeekOfYear

      public int ordinalWeekOfYear(int monthOfYear, int dayOfMonth)
      Calculates the ordinal (1st, 2nd, 3rd...) week of the year from a month and day
      Parameters:
      monthOfYear - The month of the year, 0 for leap days
      dayOfMonth - The day of the month, within [1, 28]
      Returns:
      A signed 32-bit integer within [0, 52], 0 for leap days as they belong to no week
      Throws:
      DateTimeException - If the given month or day is invalid

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • prolepticToEraYear

      public int prolepticToEraYear(int prolepticYear)
      Converts a proleptic year to the year of its respective era
      Parameters:
      prolepticYear - A number of years before (<0) or since (>= 0) 1970 ISO
      Returns:
      A signed 32-bit integer within [0, infinity)

    • normalizePeriod

      public ChronoPeriod normalizePeriod(ChronoPeriod period)
      Returns a copy of this ChronoPeriod with each unit normalized to the values used within this Chronology

      Years are assumed to be 365 days long regardless of how many leap days would occur over a number of years. 13 months will be normalized into a year, and 28 days into a month

      For instance, a period of "15 months and 42 days" would be normalized as "1 year, 3 months, and 14 days." Negative values are valid and will be counted; "-1 year and 14 months" would be normalized into "1 month"
      Parameters:
      period - A ChronoPeriod, may hold negative units, not null
      Returns:
      A new instance of a normalized ChronoPeriod
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If given a period of null

    • periodToUnit

      public long periodToUnit(ChronoPeriod period, TemporalUnit unit)
      NOTE: This method may return inconsistent results. Notes discussing this can be found at docs/MISC.md#ChronoPeriods

      Approximates how many wholes of a given TemporalUnit are represented by a given ChronoPeriod, not including the 366th day of leap years. All years equal 365 days and all months equal 28 days
      Parameters:
      period - A ChronoPeriod, may hold negative units, not null
      unit - Any ChronoUnits greater than or equal to DAYS
      Returns:
      A signed 64-bit integer number of the given unit
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If given a period of null
      UnsupportedTemporalTypeException - If given a null or invalid unit

    • unitToPeriod

      public ChronoPeriod unitToPeriod(int value, TemporalUnit unit)
      NOTE: This method may return inconsistent results. Notes discussing this can be found at docs/MISC.md#ChronoPeriods Returns a new ChronoPeriod representing a given number of a given TemporalUnit
      Parameters:
      value - A signed 32-bit integer number of units
      unit - Any ChronoUnit greater than or equal to DAYS, except FOREVER; not null
      Returns:
      A new ChronoPeriod instance
      Throws:
      UnsupportedTemporalTypeException - If given a null or invalid unit

    • periodToDays

      public long periodToDays(ChronoPeriod period)
      Calculates how many total days are represented by this ChronoPeriod, not including the 366th day of leap years. All years equal 365 days and all months equal 28 days. Negative fields are valid and will be counted; ie "-1 year and 5 days" will return -360
      Parameters:
      period - A ChronoPeriod, may hold negative units, not null
      Returns:
      A signed 64-bit integer number of days
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If given a period of null
